articles.description: According to a doctor at the University of Pennsylvania, the toes typically are painful to the touch.
articles.content:
STATEN ISLAND, N.Y. -- A coronavirus (COVID-19) symptom in children and young adults first reported in Europe is now reportedly being spotted in pediatrician offices across the U.S.
Medical professionals have dubbed the symptom COVID toes," based on a discol… [+1017 chars]

articles.title: Premature 3-week-old baby defeats coronavirus in Scotland - New York Post
articles.description: Coronavirus was no match for this wee Scottish fighter. A premature baby girl named Peyton was diagnosed with COVID-19 at just three-weeks-old, beat the bug — and was released for the hospita…
articles.content:
Coronavirus was no match for this wee Scottish fighter.
A premature baby girl named Peyton was diagnosed with COVID-19 at just three-weeks-old, beat the bug — and was released for the hospital this week, the BBC reported.

articles.title: Does coronavirus cause blood clots? A dangerous new complication arises - Sacramento Bee
What are 'COVID toes'? New skin condition possibly linked to coronavirus - KHOU.com
articles.description: A skin condition that's being called 'COVID toes' has been appearing recently in children and young adults who have no other coronavirus symptoms.
articles.content:
WASHINGTON Doctors around the country are trying to figure out whether a new mysterious skin condition could be a possible sign of coronavirus in asymptomatic patients.
